definitions.definition: not honest; intending to trick people
definitions.sensetop: dishonest with somebodydishonest about somethingit is dishonest (of somebody) (to do something)

examples.text: Beware of dishonest traders in the tourist areas.
She has been dishonest with voters.
He has been dishonest about his age and academic qualifications.
I don't like him, and it would be dishonest of me to pretend otherwise.
examples.contextForm: it is dishonest (of somebody) (to do something)

examples.text: What they are doing is not considered dishonest.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘dishonourable, unchaste’): from Old French deshoneste, Latin dehonestus.
